Count values in a character vector

Source: R/count-char.R
count.character.Rd

Method for dplyr::count()

# S3 method for character
count(x, sort = FALSE, prop = FALSE)

Arguments

x

A character vector.

sort

If TRUE, sort the result so that the most common values float to the top.

prop

If TRUE, compute the fraction of marginal table.

Value

A tibble of element counts

Examples

x <- sample(LETTERS)[rpois(1000, 10)]
table(x)
#> x
#>   A   E   F   H   I   J   K   M   N   O   P   Q   R   S   T   U   W   X 
#> 115  64  81  89   9   5  88   3  41  25   3  10 115  35 115 135  15  52 
dplyr::count(x)
#> # A tibble: 18 × 2
#>    x         n
#>    <chr> <int>
#>  1 A       115
#>  2 E        64
#>  3 F        81
#>  4 H        89
#>  5 I         9
#>  6 J         5
#>  7 K        88
#>  8 M         3
#>  9 N        41
#> 10 O        25
#> 11 P         3
#> 12 Q        10
#> 13 R       115
#> 14 S        35
#> 15 T       115
#> 16 U       135
#> 17 W        15
#> 18 X        52
dplyr::count(x, sort = TRUE, prop = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 18 × 3
#>    x         n     p
#>    <chr> <int> <dbl>
#>  1 U       135 0.135
#>  2 T       115 0.115
#>  3 R       115 0.115
#>  4 A       115 0.115
#>  5 H        89 0.089
#>  6 K        88 0.088
#>  7 F        81 0.081
#>  8 E        64 0.064
#>  9 X        52 0.052
#> 10 N        41 0.041
#> 11 S        35 0.035
#> 12 O        25 0.025
#> 13 W        15 0.015
#> 14 Q        10 0.01 
#> 15 I         9 0.009
#> 16 J         5 0.005
#> 17 P         3 0.003
#> 18 M         3 0.003
